shapes

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
      • shapes.ArbitrarySimplePolygon
        • shapes.OrientedPolygon
          • shapes.Trapezoid
            • shapes.Parallelogram
              • shapes.Rectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Rotateable, Translateable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Square

    public class Rectangle
extends Parallelogram
    A class to represent a rectangle: a parallelogram with 90 degree internal angles. A Rectangle can use the perimeter formula width*2 + height*2 instead of a more general formula. The class does not use Graphics.fillRect(int, int, int, int) in order to support rotation provided in superclasses.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rectangle

        protected Rectangle(int x,
                    int y,
                    java.awt.Color color,
                    java.awt.Point[] points,
                    int rotation,
                    int base,
                    int height)
        Constructs a new Rectangle with the given coordinates, color, Point array, rotation, base, and height. All Points are copied and translated so that the given coordinates equal the top left corner of the bounding box for the polygon specified in the Point array with the specified rotation. The first and last Points are to be joined by a line segment, in addition to all consecutive elements.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of this Rectangle.
        y - The y coordinate of this Rectangle.
        color - The Color to draw this Rectangle with.
        points - The Points which specify a path that forms a rectangle.
        rotation - The amount, in degrees, this Rectangle is rotated from its intial orientation. A positive value results in an anticlockwise rotation.
        base - The length of this Rectangle's base (the width).
        height - The height of this Rectangle.

    • Method Detail

      • calculatePerimeter

        protected double calculatePerimeter()
        Calculates and returns the perimeter of this Shape. It is almost certainly a better idea to use Shape.getPerimeter() instead, as that stores the result so the calculation only occurs once.

        The calculation made is width*2 + height*2.

        Overrides:
        calculatePerimeter in class ArbitrarySimplePolygon
        Returns:
        double, the perimeter of this Shape.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of this Rectangle. Equal to the length of the base and the opposite base.
        Returns:
        int, the width of this Rectangle.
